column3: It's more efficient if you file these with @theuni's repository on the trivial-next branch directly: https://github.com/theuni/bitcoin\n

Yes, please do that.

I'll go ahead and review/pull these (along with some others that are waiting) tomorrow, but submitting them directly to the trivial tree would be much better.

I'm not comfortable pulling these into trivial.
1. The authenticated/secure debate has been hashed out here before and I'm not sure how it ended up.
2. The defaultConfirmTarget mixes a small functional change with a cosmetic one.

Feel free to just take the one commit that matches your Trivial specs :). I didn't want to start a new debate, but recently I've been using the authenticated term when dealing with payment requests and also took that from pull-request discussions, when discussing with others.\n

> The authenticated/secure debate has been hashed out here before and I'm not sure how it ended up.

"Authenticated" is more apt. "Insecure" is ambiguous.
Agree @cfields that functional changes, even minor ones, should not end up in the trivial branch. That could be very dangerous, even a small change can result in big bugs.\n
I thought there was consensus for writing bitcoin with a lower case b when we are talking about the currency.\n
